content.p: Using the diagram of a sample of blood that has been centrifuged to separate it into its component parts answer the following questions:

question.body: What makes up the largest fraction of blood?

response.feedback: Correct. Plasma is the liquid portion of the blood and makes up about 55% of blood by volume.
Incorrect. Leukocytes are white blood cells and make up less than 1% of the blood.
Incorrect. Platelets are part of the buffy coat with the white blood cells and make up less than 1% of the blood.
Incorrect. The erythrocytes are the red blood cells and make up 45% of the blood which is less than another fraction.

part.hint: Look for what takes up the most space in the test tube of separated blood.
The plasma does not contain cells so it is the most trasnlucent portion of blood.

question.body: Why do erythrocytes appear on the bottom of the tube after it has been centrifuged?

multiple_choice.choice: they are less dense than water

response.feedback: Incorrect. The oxygen they carry does not make them the most dense, and density determines where they end up after centrifugation.
Incorrect. Erythrocytes are smaller than the white blood cells.
Incorrect. They are more dense than water.
Correct. The heme group contains iron which makes these cells the most dense so they end up on the bottom.

part.hint: Think about what element they need to carry oxygen.

question.body: What is the function(s) of the smallest portion of the blood?

multiple_choice.choice: carry oxygen and defend against infection
defend against infection and contribute to hemostasis
defended against infection and regulate water homeostasis

response.feedback: Incorrect. The Erythrocytes which make up 45% of the blood are responsible for carrying the oxygen.
Incorrect. The Erythrocytes which make up 45% of the blood are responsible for carrying the oxygen.
Correct. The buffy coat contains both the leukocytes, which are responsible for defending against infection, and the platelets, which help prevent blood loss (hemostasis).
Incorrect. The proteins in the plasma help to regulate water homeostasis and blood pressure.

part.hint: This portion of blood is called the buffy coat.
This portion contains white blood cells and platelets.
